TaxonIdentification.variety_authority: H. St. John & F. A. Warren

treatment.description: Plants 4–7 dm. Aerial flowering stems stout, often fistulose, 2–5 dm, usually glabrous, rarely floccose. Leaf blades ovate to deltoid, (2–)7–25 × 2–8 cm. Involucres sparsely to densely lanate. Flowers 5–6 mm; perianth pale to bright yellow. 2n = 40.
treatment.habitat: sandy to gravelly flats and slopes
treatment.discussion: Variety compositum is widespread and common from central-northern Washington and west-central Idaho south through Oregon to northern California.
